intro: Lasianthaea seemannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, making it a popular ornamental plant. Lasianthaea seemannii is known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
